plants.name: Aster amellus
plants.description: A hardy perennial native to Europe, producing daisy-like violet to purple flowers. It blooms late in the season, adding vibrant color to gardens when many other plants have finished blooming.
plants.funFact: Michaelmas daisies are named after the feast of Michaelmas, celebrated on September 29, because they bloom around this time.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A widely cultivated and native North American wildflower with bright yellow petals and a dark brown center disc. It provides late summer to early autumn color and is a favorite for pollinators.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are important nectar sources for butterflies and bees in late summer landscapes.

plants.name: Cyclamen hederifolium
plants.description: A bulbous perennial native to parts of Europe and the Mediterranean. It blooms in early autumn with delicate pink or white flowers and decorative variegated leaves, often under deciduous trees.
plants.funFact: Cyclamen hederifolium is one of the few plants that bloom in autumn when many other flowers have faded.

plants.name: Dendrobium nobile
plants.description: An epiphytic orchid from Asia, it blooms in late winter to early autumn depending on the climate, with elegant clusters of fragrant purple and white flowers.
plants.funFact: Dendrobium orchids are commonly used in traditional medicines in Asia for their purported health benefits.
